guide:
# Fanfiction Canon Guide

## Characters
One file per character. For source material characters, note:
- What you're keeping from the original
- Any reinterpretation of personality or background
- Where in the source timeline you're picking them up

For OCs, write a full character sheet — personality, appearance, role, constraints.

## Locations
One file per significant location. Note whether it's from the source material or original.

## Canon Deviations
One file per significant departure from the source material. Include:
- What the original version is
- What your version changes
- Why (AU premise, fix-it, divergence point)
- Downstream effects — what else changes because of this

This is the most important canon type for fanfic. Being explicit about deviations prevents accidental contradictions — you'll know whether you meant to change something or just forgot the original.

## Original Additions
One file per new element you've added to the universe. Include:
- What it is and how it fits
- Why it doesn't contradict the source material (or how it does, intentionally)
- Which characters interact with it
